answers.answer: Hi there,PAD is peripheral artery disease in which there is atherosclerosis of the peripheral blood vessels leading to obstruction in the blood flow.The characteristic symptom of PAD is a painful muscle cramping in the hips, thighs or calves when walking, climbing stairs or exercising. The pain usually goes away when you stop the activity. There are certain risk factors associated with this condition like aging, cardiovascular disease or stroke, personal or family history of PAD.Obesity, cigarette smoking, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, physical inactivity and diabetes mellitus are other risk factors. Doppler ultrasound, magnetic resonance angiography is done to diagnose this condition. The complications of PAD are increased risk of coronary artery disease, loss of a leg, stroke and carotid atherosclerosis. Hope this helps. Do keep us posted.Take care and regards!
